overview: From 2026-01-22 to 2026-01-23, elizaos/elizaos.github.io had 2 new PRs (1 merged), 3 new issues, and 2 active contributors.

topIssues.title: fix: Overall summaries not generated for days with no repository activity
topIssues.author: madjin
topIssues.body:
## Problem

Overall summary API endpoints return 404 for dates with no repository activity:
- `/api/summaries/overall/day/2026-01-01.json` ‚Üí 404 ‚ùå
- `/api/summaries/overall/day/2026-01-02.json` ‚Üí 200 ‚úÖ

## Expected Behavior

The API should return a summary for **every day the pipeline runs**, even if there's no activity:

```json
{
  "version": "1.0",
  "type": "overall",
  "interval": "day",
  "date": "2026-01-01",
  "generatedAt": "2026-01-02T00:00:00.000Z",
  "contentFormat": "markdown",
  "content": "No activity recorded for January 1, 2026."
}
```

## Root Cause

[`generateOverallSummaryForInterval()`](https://github.com/elizaOS/elizaos.github.io/blob/main/src/lib/pipelines/summarize/generateOverallSummary.ts#L70-L76) returns `null` when no repository summaries exist:

```typescript
const repoSummaries = await getAllRepoSummariesForInterval(interval);
if (repoSummaries.length === 0) {
  intervalLogger?.debug(
    `No repository summaries found for ${intervalType} of ${startDate}, skipping overall summary generation.`,
  );
  return null; // ‚Üê This causes the 404
}
```

## Evidence

```bash
# Jan 1 had ZERO activity (New Year's Day)
$ sqlite3 data/db.sqlite "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM raw_pull_requests WHERE DATE(created_at) = '2026-01-01';"
0

$ sqlite3 data/db.sqlite "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM raw_issues WHERE DATE(created_at) = '2026-01-01';"
0

# Database has monthly summary but NO daily summary
$ sqlite3 data/db.sqlite "SELECT date, interval_type, LENGTH(summary) FROM overall_summaries WHERE date = '2026-01-01';"
2026-01-01|month|4320
```

## Solution

Always generate a summary, even when `repoSummaries.length === 0`:

```typescript
const repoSummaries = await getAllRepoSummariesForInterval(interval);

// Generate summary even if no repo summaries exist
const summary = repoSummaries.length > 0
  ? await generateOverallSummary(
      repoSummaries,
      aiSummaryConfig,
      { startDate },
      intervalType as RepoIntervalType,
    )
  : `No activity recorded for ${intervalType} of ${startDate}.`;

if (\!summary) {
  intervalLogger?.debug(
    `Overall summary generation resulted in no content for ${startDate}, skipping storage.`,
  );
  return;
}

// Store and export the summary...
```

## Impact

- API consumers can't distinguish between "no data" and "endpoint not generated"
- 404s break API contract that promises daily summaries
- Inconsistent API behavior (some days exist, others don't)
- Downstream tools must handle unexpected 404s

## Design Philosophy

Per the API documentation:
> "404 responses indicate artifacts not yet published."

But this should mean "pipeline hasn't run yet", NOT "no activity that day". If the pipeline runs daily, every day should have a summary‚Äîeven if it says "no activity."

## References

- API Documentation: https://elizaos.github.io/api
- Generation code: `src/lib/pipelines/summarize/generateOverallSummary.ts:70-76`
- OpenAPI spec: https://elizaos.github.io/openapi.json

topIssues.title: fix: API index and contributor profiles not exported due to missing SITE_URL in run-pipelines workflow
topIssues.author: madjin
topIssues.body:
## Problem

The following API endpoints return 404 on production:
- `/api/index.json`
- `/api/contributors/{username}/profile.json` (all 1,433 contributor profiles)

Meanwhile, these endpoints work fine:
- `/api/leaderboard-*.json` ‚úÖ
- `/api/summaries/**` ‚úÖ

## Root Cause

The `run-pipelines.yml` workflow doesn't set the `SITE_URL` environment variable when running `bun run pipeline export-leaderboard`.

Without `SITE_URL`, the following functions skip exporting:
- [`exportAPIIndex()`](https://github.com/elizaOS/elizaos.github.io/blob/main/src/lib/pipelines/export/exportLeaderboardAPI.ts#L1180-L1184) - skips with warning "SITE_URL not configured"
- [`exportAllUserProfiles()`](https://github.com/elizaOS/elizaos.github.io/blob/main/src/lib/pipelines/export/exportLeaderboardAPI.ts#L1078-L1081) - skips with info "Skipping user profiles: SITE_URL not configured"

The files ARE generated locally during `deploy.yml` build (12MB of contributor profiles), but they're generated too late‚Äîafter the pipelines have already run.

## Evidence

```bash
# Files exist locally after build
$ ls -lh out/api/
drwxr-xr-x 1435 jin jin   36M contributors/  # ‚Üê 404 on production
-rw-r--r--    1 jin jin  4.0K index.json      # ‚Üê 404 on production
-rw-r--r--    1 jin jin  2.6M leaderboard-lifetime.json  # ‚úÖ works
-rw-r--r--    1 jin jin   34K leaderboard-monthly.json   # ‚úÖ works
drwxr-xr-x    5 jin jin  4.0K summaries/      # ‚úÖ works
```

```bash
# Production only has these
$ curl -s https://elizaos.github.io/api/ | grep href
href="summaries/"
href="leaderboard-lifetime.json"
href="leaderboard-monthly.json"
href="leaderboard-weekly.json"
```

## Solution

Add SITE_URL to `run-pipelines.yml` env section:

```yaml
env:
  GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
  OPENROUTER_API_KEY: ${{ secrets.OPENROUTER_API_KEY }}
  PIPELINE_DATA_BRANCH: "_data"
  DATA_DIR: "data"
  SITE_URL: ${{ secrets.SITE_URL || 'https://elizaos.github.io' }}  # ‚Üê Add this
  PIPELINE_CONFIG_FILE: ${{ secrets.PIPELINE_CONFIG_FILE || 'config/example.json' }}
```

Or detect it dynamically like `deploy.yml` does:
```yaml
- name: Determine site URL
  id: site-config
  run: |
    if [[ "${{ github.event.repository.name }}" == *.github.io ]]; then
      echo "site_url=https://${{ github.repository_owner }}.github.io" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
    fi
```

## Impact

- 12MB of contributor profile data not accessible via API
- API discovery endpoint (`/api/index.json`) returns 404
- Third-party tools can't discover API capabilities
- Documentation references broken endpoints

## References

- API Documentation: https://elizaos.github.io/api
- OpenAPI Spec: https://elizaos.github.io/openapi.json
- Export code: `src/lib/pipelines/export/exportLeaderboardAPI.ts`

topIssues.title: Stats files always have null contributor summaries due to pipeline ordering
topIssues.author: madjin
topIssues.body:
## Problem

Contributor summaries are always `null` in exported stats files (e.g., `data/elizaos_eliza/stats/day/stats_2026-01-20.json`), even when contributor summaries exist in the database.

## Root Cause

Pipeline ordering issue in `.github/workflows/run-pipelines.yml`:

1. **Job 1: `ingest-export`** (lines 60-146)
   - Runs `bun run pipeline export` 
   - Generates stats files with `topContributors` array
   - At this point, NO contributor summaries exist ‚Üí all `summary` fields are `null`

2. **Job 2: `generate-summaries`** (lines 148-340) 
   - Runs AFTER job 1 completes
   - Generates contributor summaries and stores them in database
   - Stats files are NEVER re-exported to pick up the new summaries

## Evidence

```bash
# Stats file generated before summaries exist:
$ cat data/elizaos_eliza/stats/day/stats_2026-01-16.json | jq '.topContributors[0]'
{
  "username": "0xbbjoker",
  ...
  "summary": null  # ‚Üê Always null
}

# But summary exists in database:
$ sqlite3 data/db.sqlite "SELECT LENGTH(summary) FROM user_summaries WHERE username = '0xbbjoker' AND date = '2026-01-16' AND interval_type = 'day';"
166  # ‚Üê Summary has 166 characters
```

## Solution

Re-export stats files after contributor summaries are generated. Options:

### Option 1: Add export step to generate-summaries job (Recommended)
After line 261 in `.github/workflows/run-pipelines.yml`, add:
```yaml
- name: Re-export stats with contributor summaries
  run: bun run pipeline export --days 7 -f
```

### Option 2: Separate job with dependency
Create a third job that runs after `generate-summaries` to re-export stats.

## Impact

- All contributor summaries in stats files are missing, even though they exist in the database
- Frontend/API consumers see `summary: null` instead of rich contributor activity descriptions
- Affects all interval types (day, week, month)

## Related Files

- `.github/workflows/run-pipelines.yml`
- `src/lib/pipelines/export/queries.ts:114-165` (`getTopContributors` function)
- `src/lib/pipelines/export/exportRepoStats.ts:17-97` (`exportRepoStatsForInterval` function)

topPRs.title: Fix API issues: missing files and no-activity summaries
topPRs.author: madjin
topPRs.body:
## Summary Fixes #225 and #226 **Issue #225: Missing API files** (`/api/index.json`, `/api/contributors/*`) - Root cause: `run-pipelines.yml` workflow didn't set `SITE_URL` env var - Fix: Added dynamic site URL detection step (copied pattern from `deploy.yml`) - Now exports API index and contributor profiles correctly **Issue #226: Missing summaries for no-activity days** - Root cause: `generateOverallSummaryForInterval()` returned early when no repo summaries found - Fix: Generate simple "No activity recorded" message instead of skipping - Ensures every valid date returns 200 instead of 404 ## Changes - `.github/workflows/run-pipelines.yml`: Added SITE_URL detection step before API exports - `src/lib/pipelines/summarize/generateOverallSummary.ts`: Generate no-activity summaries ## Test Plan - [ ] CI checks pass (build, typecheck, lint) - [ ] Manual workflow_dispatch run after merge - [ ] Verify `/api/index.json` exists - [ ] Verify `/api/contributors/*` files exist - [ ] Verify no-activity days return 200 with simple message ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Greptile Summary

Fixed two critical API issues preventing proper API functionality in production. **Issue #225 - Missing API Files**: Added dynamic `SITE_URL` detection step in `run-pipelines.yml` before API exports, mirroring the pattern already used in `deploy.yml`. Without this environment variable, the export functions (`exportAPIIndex()` and `exportAllUserProfiles()`) were silently skipping generation, resulting in 404s for `/api/index.json` and all 1,433 contributor profile endpoints. The fix correctly detects whether the repository is an org site (`*.github.io`) or project site and passes the appropriate URL to both export commands. **Issue #226 - Missing No-Activity Summaries**: Modified `generateOverallSummaryForInterval()` to generate simple "No activity recorded for {date}" messages instead of returning null when no repository summaries exist. This ensures consistent API behavior where every date the pipeline runs returns 200, distinguishing "no activity that day" from "pipeline hasn't run yet" (legitimate 404). The implementation correctly stores these no-activity summaries in the database and exports them to both markdown and JSON API formats. Both fixes are minimal, well-targeted changes that address the root causes without introducing unnecessary complexity. The workflow change follows established patterns, and the summary generation maintains proper error handling and logging.

Confidence Score: 5/5

- Safe to merge - targeted fixes with minimal risk - Both changes are straightforward bug fixes addressing well-documented issues. The workflow change copies an established pattern from deploy.yml, and the summary generation logic correctly handles the empty-summaries case without affecting existing functionality. No breaking changes, security issues, or architectural concerns. - No files require special attention

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | .github/workflows/run-pipelines.yml | Added SITE_URL detection step before API exports to fix missing API files. Implementation correctly mirrors deploy.yml pattern and provides env vars to both export commands. | | src/lib/pipelines/summarize/generateOverallSummary.ts | Modified to generate "No activity recorded" summaries instead of returning null for days with no repository activity, ensuring 200 responses for all valid dates. |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Workflow as run-pipelines.yml participant SummaryStep as generateOverallSummary participant ExportAPI as exportLeaderboardAPI participant API as /api/* endpoints Note over Workflow: Daily scheduled run (23:00 UTC) Workflow->>Workflow: Run summaries (repo ‚Üí contributor ‚Üí overall) Workflow->>SummaryStep: Generate overall summaries alt No repository activity SummaryStep->>SummaryStep: Check getAllRepoSummariesForInterval() SummaryStep->>SummaryStep: repoSummaries.length === 0 SummaryStep->>SummaryStep: Generate "No activity recorded" message SummaryStep->>API: Store summary (200 response) else Has activity SummaryStep->>SummaryStep: generateOverallSummary() with AI SummaryStep->>API: Store summary (200 response) end Workflow->>Workflow: Determine site URL (new step) Note over Workflow: Detects *.github.io vs project repo Workflow->>ExportAPI: export-leaderboard (with SITE_URL env) ExportAPI->>API: Generate /api/index.json ExportAPI->>API: Generate /api/contributors/*/profile.json ExportAPI->>API: Generate leaderboard-*.json Workflow->>ExportAPI: export-summaries (with SITE_URL env) ExportAPI->>API: Export summary JSON files ```

topPRs.title: Fix: re-export stats after contributor summaries are generated
topPRs.author: madjin
topPRs.body:
## Summary Fixes #228 Stats files (`data/elizaos_eliza/stats/day/stats_*.json`) always had `summary: null` for contributors, even when summaries existed in the database. This was due to a pipeline ordering issue. ## Problem The workflow had stats being exported BEFORE contributor summaries were generated: 1. `ingest-export` job ‚Üí exports stats files (summaries don't exist yet ‚Üí `summary: null`) 2. `generate-summaries` job ‚Üí creates contributor summaries 3. Stats files never re-exported to include summaries ## Solution Added a re-export step after summary generation completes (line 293): ```yaml - name: Re-export stats with contributor summaries run: bun run pipeline export${{ env.start_date_arg }}${{ env.end_date_arg }}${{ github.event_name == 'schedule' && ' --days 2' || '' }} -f ``` **Behavior:** - **Scheduled runs**: Re-export last 2 days only (`--days 2`) - **Manual runs with date range**: Re-export the specified date range - **Manual runs without dates**: Re-export everything missing ## Why Three Export Steps? The workflow now has three export commands, each serving a purpose: 1. **Line 119**: Export everything missing (respects manual date ranges) 2. **Line 120**: Force re-export last 2 days for data completeness (April 2025 "overlap" feature) 3. **Line 293 (NEW)**: Force re-export WITH summaries after generation This preserves the existing "overlap" safety feature while ensuring summaries are included when available. ## Test Plan - [ ] CI checks pass - [ ] Manual workflow run to verify summary inclusion - [ ] Verify scheduled runs only re-export 2 days - [ ] Verify manual runs with date range respect inputs ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Greptile Overview

Greptile Summary

Fixes stats files missing contributor summaries by adding a re-export step after summary generation completes. **Key changes:** - Added re-export command on line 293 after all summary generation completes - For scheduled runs: re-exports last 2 days only (`--days 2`) - For manual runs: respects date range inputs or re-exports everything if no dates specified - Preserves existing "overlap" safety feature (line 120) for data completeness **Why this works:** The original workflow exported stats BEFORE summaries existed (lines 119-120 in `ingest-export` job), resulting in `summary: null`. The new re-export step runs AFTER contributor summaries are generated in the `generate-summaries` job, ensuring stats files include the actual summary text. **Implementation is correct:** - Uses same date range environment variables (`${{ env.start_date_arg }}${{ env.end_date_arg }}`) - Applies `-f` flag to force overwrite of existing stats files - Conditional logic for scheduled runs (`--days 2`) matches existing pattern on line 120

Confidence Score: 5/5

- This PR is safe to merge with minimal risk - The change is a simple, well-documented addition that fixes a clear pipeline ordering bug. The new export command follows established patterns (uses same env vars, flags, and conditional logic as existing exports on lines 119-120), ensuring consistency. No breaking changes or risky operations introduced. - No files require special attention

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | .github/workflows/run-pipelines.yml | Added re-export step after summary generation to include contributor summaries in stats files |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Workflow as GitHub Actions participant IngestJob as ingest-export job participant SummaryJob as generate-summaries job participant DB as SQLite Database participant DataFiles as Stats JSON Files Note over Workflow: Workflow starts (scheduled/manual) Workflow->>IngestJob: Start job activate IngestJob IngestJob->>DB: Run ingest pipeline IngestJob->>DB: Run process pipeline IngestJob->>DataFiles: Export stats (line 119) Note right of DataFiles: summaries don't exist yet
contributor.summary = null IngestJob->>DataFiles: Re-export last 2 days (line 120) Note right of DataFiles: Still no summaries
contributor.summary = null IngestJob->>Workflow: Job complete deactivate IngestJob Workflow->>SummaryJob: Start job (needs: ingest-export) activate SummaryJob SummaryJob->>DB: Import markdown summaries SummaryJob->>DB: Generate repository summaries SummaryJob->>DB: Generate contributor summaries Note right of DB: Summaries now exist in DB SummaryJob->>DB: Generate overall summaries SummaryJob->>DataFiles: Re-export WITH summaries (line 293 NEW) Note right of DataFiles: NOW includes summaries
contributor.summary = actual text SummaryJob->>DataFiles: Export leaderboard JSON SummaryJob->>DataFiles: Export summaries to JSON API SummaryJob->>Workflow: Job complete deactivate SummaryJob ```

Fixes #228 

Stats files (`data/elizaos_eliza/stats/day/stats_*.json`) always had `summary: null` for contributors, even when summaries existed in the database. This was due to a pipeline ordering issue.

## Problem

The workflow

topContributors.summary: madjin: Focused on critical bug fixes, resolving issues such as null contributor summaries (elizaos/elizaos.github.io#228) and missing API exports (elizaos/elizaos.github.io#225), and also merged a fix to re-export stats after contributor summaries are generated (elizaos/elizaos.github.io#229), primarily impacting bugfix work and configuration.
